radiographic_examinations.findings: The lung bases are clear, with minimal bibasilar atelectasis. There is no pleural or pericardial effusion. A hypodensity is present in the anterior portion of segment 4a/b, likely representing a cyst. A 1.6 x 1.6 x 2.0-cm nodule within the medial limb of the right adrenal gland, which is new from a previous study. The appendix is dilated measuring up to 1.4 cm and fluid filled, with surrounding inflammatory change. An appendicolith is seen lodged within the base. No evidence of perforation.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The nodule within the medial limb of the right adrenal gland is new from a previous study. The hypodensity in segment 4a/b is unchanged from a previous study.
